channel.title: Metals Industry News Feed
channel.description: Automated news feed for aluminum, steel, copper, and nickel industries

item.title: Nickel still capped by surplus
item.description: Indonesia's nickel supply growth, particularly via HPAL technology converting low-grade laterite ore to battery-grade nickel, will keep the market in surplus through 2026 despite EV demand. Environmental concerns over HPAL's acid use and waste are increasing scrutiny, potentially impacting future approvals and supply. Shifts to LFP batteries, which use less nickel, further cap demand for nickel-intensive chemistries.

item.title: BofA Sees Growth Potential for Prysmian from US Tariffs
item.description: Bank of America projects that US copper tariffs imposed by President Trump could boost Prysmian's 2026 EBITDA by EUR500 million to EUR1 billion, representing up to 30% of estimates. The advantage stems from Prysmian's copper cable production now being almost entirely US-based following the Encore Wire acquisition, with potential 10% price increases in medium and low-voltage segments where imports face 41% average tariffs.

item.title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
item.description: Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance after reporting third-quarter revenue of EUR5.03 billion, 3% above consensus, driven by strong Renewable Transmission and Power Grids performance. Analysts note the company is likely not yet seeing copper tariff benefits, but expect significant positive impacts in 2026.

item.title: Aluminium hits $3,000 after 3 years as supply tightens
item.description: Aluminium prices hit $3,000 per tonne for the first time in over three years due to tightening supply. The surge raises questions on investment strategies amid ongoing market dynamics. No further details on specific drivers provided in the snippet.

item.title: Move over gold and silver: Copper, aluminium head for monster rally in 2026; household goods to get costlier
item.description: Aluminum prices climbed past USD 3,000 a tonne for the first time in over three years, driven by supply constraints like China's smelting caps and Europe's reduced output. Demand from construction, renewables, and infrastructure remains strong, with futures up 17% last year. This rally is increasing costs for household goods like appliances.

item.title: The 2026 shifting focus reshapes the US critical minerals strategy beyond rare-earth
item.description: US critical minerals policy in 2026 prioritizes domestic processing, energy efficiency, and lower-cost technologies for metals like aluminum amid rising electricity demand from AI data centers. It shifts from new mines to refining and smelting alternatives to reduce emissions and power costs. This supports high-risk minerals and technologies for domestic processing in energy and manufacturing sectors.

item.title: U.S. Steelmakers Prep for $1.6 Billion in 1Q Project Starts
item.description: U.S. steelmakers like U.S. Steel and Cleveland-Cliffs are preparing over $1.6 billion in steel-manufacturing projects set to begin construction in Q1 2026, focusing on capacity expansions and restarts to meet rising demand. Key projects include restarting Furnace B at U.S. Steel's Granite City Steel Works and Cleveland-Cliffs replacing furnaces at Butler Steel Works for efficiency gains. Nippon Steel commits to no closures of U.S. Steel facilities before 2035.

item.title: Steel Industry praises Trump tariffs, farmers feel the strain
item.description: US steel industry leaders praise Trump tariffs for countering global oversupply and subsidies from countries like China, benefiting domestic production without shortages. W&W AFCO Steel, focused on infrastructure, reports positive impacts from tariffs driving fairer market dynamics. The company sources only domestic steel for projects like bridges and stadiums.

item.title: Sustainability Indicators Report 2025
item.description: The World Steel Association released its Sustainability Indicators Report 2025, presenting nineteen sustainability indicators for the steel industry along with a historical overview. This report underscores the industry's commitment to transparent data disclosure, continual improvement in environmental performance, and pathways to reduce CO2 emissions. It highlights steel's role in the circular economy and sustainable practices like water management and air quality control.

item.title: EU's carbon border tax on heavy industry goods goes into effect, risking trade escalation
item.description: The EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) took effect on 1 January 2026, requiring steel and aluminium exporters to pay for CO2 emissions linked to their production. This measure aims to protect EU manufacturers from carbon leakage and encourage global adoption of carbon pricing and cleaner production methods. Critics argue it acts as protectionism, potentially raising costs and complicating trade.

item.title: Roadmap for Iron & Steel Manufacturing
item.description: AIST unveiled the Roadmap for Iron and Steel Manufacturing, funded by the U.S. Department of Commerce and NIST, outlining technologies, infrastructure, and workforce strategies to decarbonize the U.S. iron and steel industry. The roadmap focuses on revolutionizing U.S. global leadership for a sustainable industrial supply chain. It emphasizes innovation to strengthen competitiveness while addressing environmental challenges.

item.title: Exclusive interview with José Jiménez from Atlantic Copper - Transforming e-scrap
item.description: Atlantic Copper, a leading European copper producer, discusses its CirCular project, which valorizes e-scrap from recycled electronics using advanced metallurgical processes and circular economy principles. The initiative addresses resource scarcity, reduces landfill waste and CO₂ emissions, and aligns with the EU Green Deal, with production set to start in the second half of 2026. Sponsorship of IERC 2026 underscores their commitment to innovation, collaboration, and sustainability in copper production for electrification and renewable energy.

item.title: Nickel Higher on Mine Suspension
item.description: Nickel rose 1.6% to $16,910, breaking 14-month highs due to Vale Indonesia's mine suspension and the government's plan to cut nickel ore output by a third in 2026. The move aims to support prices amid prior oversupply. Other metals like aluminum also gained on supply constraints.

item.title: Ultrahigh-Nickel Cathodes Near Density Limit
item.description: Researchers have developed ultrahigh-nickel single-crystalline oxide cathodes that achieve unprecedented particle sizes with pristine structural order, addressing capacity degradation and instability in lithium-ion batteries. These cathodes approach the theoretical density limit, enhancing volumetric capacity, cycle life, and safety for electric vehicles. The innovation supports industrial scalability and sustainable energy storage solutions.

item.title: Year-End Aluminum Ingot Inventory Alert Sounded! Domestic Inventory Buildup in Q1 2026 a Foregone Conclusion - SMM Analysis
item.description: Domestic aluminum production increased 1.9% YoY and 4.0% MoM in December due to new capacities in Inner Mongolia and Xinjiang, boosting supply. Casting volumes rose, reducing liquid aluminum proportion to 75.1% expected in January 2026, pressuring ingot inventories to build up to around 730,000 mt by end-January. High prices and steady shipments amplify inventory pressure ahead of Chinese New Year.

item.title: National subsidy policy funds disbursed, inventory buildup reality limits upside potential for aluminium prices
item.description: New aluminum projects in China and Indonesia ramped up production, with a new Inner Mongolia project powering on December 20, expecting further daily output growth. High prices and environmental controls suppressed downstream demand, leading to inventory buildup to 660,000 tonnes. Despite subsidy funds for consumer trade-ins boosting medium-term demand, weak spot consumption caps price upside.

item.title: Vedanta's Q3 Production Update: Aluminium & Zinc Surge, But Oil & Gas Dips - Investor Alert!
item.description: Vedanta Ltd reported a 1% rise in aluminium output for Q3 FY24 (December quarter). Mined metal production increased 4% at Zinc India and 28% at Zinc International, with saleable iron ore up 3%. Oil & gas and steel production declined, reflecting mixed segment performance.

item.title: Vedanta Q3 production: Aluminium, zinc, iron ore up; steel, oil & gas down
item.description: Mining giant Vedanta Ltd reported rises in aluminium, zinc, and iron ore production during the December quarter. Aluminium output specifically increased, contributing to growth in key metal segments. Steel and oil & gas production declined in the same period.

item.title: Sustainable Innovation Powers Aluminium Can Market Expansion
item.description: Sustainability is driving growth in the aluminum can market, with Ball Corporation forecasting global demand of 470 billion units by 2026, particularly in India. The company emphasizes aluminum's infinite recyclability, innovations in retort technology and refill systems, and investments in low-carbon production like ELYSIS technology. Ball has reduced Scope 1 and 2 emissions by 21% by 2024 and aims for 85% recycled content.

item.title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever debut carbon-free aluminium aerosol packaging
item.description: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever have launched an innovative aerosol can using 50% ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum and 50% post-consumer recycled content, eliminating direct GHG emissions from smelting. This breakthrough, ahead of COP30, combines low-carbon primary aluminum with high recycled content to decarbonize packaging in personal and home care sectors. Executives highlight its role in delivering tangible sustainability benefits and meeting consumer demand.

item.title: 2026 Steel Price Outlook: Will Scrap Steel Price continue late 2025 uptick or is this the same old seasonality story?
item.description: December 2025 steel scrap prices showed a slight increase, sparking hope for 2026, but historical data from 2023-2025 reveals recurring winter upticks followed by declines throughout the year. Philadelphia busheling prices peaked in early year periods before dropping significantly. Market participants question if current gains have lasting power beyond seasonality.[5]

item.title: SSAB Americas raises prices for rolled steel by at least $40/t
item.description: The American division of Swedish steel manufacturer SSAB has announced a price increase of at least $40 per short ton for all its rolled steel products. This adjustment reflects ongoing market dynamics in the US steel sector.[7]

item.title: CCTV+: Xi Outlines Main Directions for Developing New Quality Productive Forces
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping emphasized technological innovation and upgrading in traditional industries like steel during inspections at Bensteel Group. He stressed the steel industry's role as a fundamental sector for the real economy and the need for sci-tech empowerment in manufacturing. Xi advocated continuing to strengthen manufacturing and mastering independent technologies for Chinese modernization.

item.title: Goldman Sachs Research: Copper prices to decline in 2026
item.description: Goldman Sachs Research forecasts copper prices to decline to an average of $10,710 per metric ton in the first half of 2026, ranging $10,000-$11,000 for the year, due to a global supply surplus despite strong demand from grid and power infrastructure. Potential U.S. tariffs on refined copper imports of at least 25% could boost demand next year. Longer-term, prices are expected to rise, reaching $15,000 per metric ton by 2035 as demand outpaces supply from 2029.

item.title: Copper Prices Are Forecast to Decline Somewhat from Record Highs in 2026
item.description: Goldman Sachs Research predicts copper prices will decline to $10,000-$11,000 in 2026 from record highs, due to ongoing global supply surplus, despite rallies from lower interest rates, weaker USD, and AI spending. Chinese demand fell -8% year-on-year in Q4 2025. U.S. tariffs on refined copper imports by mid-2026 could increase demand, with long-term forecasts at $15,000 per tonne by 2035.

item.title: Gold, silver, and copper prices surge again — here's the 2026 gold, silver, and copper outlook amid policy risks, supply deficits and structural demand
item.description: Copper ended 2025 near $5.6787 per pound, up 36% for the year, supported by AI infrastructure, data centers, green energy demand, and supply disruptions in Indonesia, Chile, and Peru. Analysts forecast higher metals prices in 2026 amid policy risks and tightening supply. Current prices hover around $5.51–$5.80 per pound.

item.title: Copper price plunges in New York after hitting new high in London
item.description: Copper prices surged toward $13,000 a tonne in London on Monday, up 1.6% after a 6.6% intraday jump, amid mine outages and U.S. tariff speculation driving a 35% yearly gain. New York futures plunged 6% to $5.56 a pound after erasing gains. Long-term strain expected from energy transition demand tripling by 2045, potentially causing deficits as early as 2026.

item.title: Kamoa-Kakula smelter produces its first copper anodes
item.description: Ivanhoe Mines announced that the Kamoa-Kakula smelter in the DRC has produced its first copper anodes using its state-of-the-art 500,000-tonne-per-annum facility. This milestone advances on-site copper processing, enhancing efficiency and reducing reliance on external refineries. The development supports sustainable production amid growing global copper demand.

item.title: Nickel Prices Jump After Top Producer Indonesia Signals 2026 Output Cut
item.description: Spot nickel rose to $16,500 a tonne from $15,800, with the LME three-month contract up 6.4% on Dec. 30, following Indonesia's plan to cut 2026 nickel production to balance supply and demand amid rising LME inventories. The country, now holding 60.2% of global market share, aims to curb surplus, support prices, and limit environmental impact. This mirrors DRC's cobalt production quotas to lift prices.

item.title: [SMM Analysis] 2025 Nickel Market Recap & 2026 Outlook: Oversupply to Weigh on Prices
item.description: Late December news of Indonesia planning significant 2026 nickel ore quota cuts sparked bullish sentiment, driving LME nickel prices to around $16,000/mt from yearly lows. The 2025 recap shows quarterly price fluctuations due to tariffs, inventories, and demand weakness, with social inventory up 41% YoY by mid-December. For 2026, oversupply is expected to pressure prices despite supply cut expectations.

item.title: How 2026 will reshape the US critical minerals resilience
item.description: Federal attention is shifting toward metals processing innovation beyond rare earths, with emphasis on technologies that reduce emissions and production costs while maintaining global competitiveness. Companies demonstrating reliable and cost-effective processing technologies will be positioned for federal funding as the US prioritizes critical mineral independence and sustainable mining practices.

item.title: Aluminum starts the year on a bullish note
item.description: Aluminum prices have surpassed $3,000 per ton on the Comex and LME exchanges, driven by reduced output and inventory levels in China and Europe due to capacity caps and high electricity costs. U.S. Comex listed aluminum at $3,050.75 per metric ton before trading on Jan. 5, up 1.6%, while LME showed $3,015.50 per ton. Demand from construction and renewables remains strong, with LME inventories declining significantly in November 2025.

item.title: Aluminum price hits $3,000 for first time since 2022 on supply concern
item.description: Aluminum prices climbed above $3,000 per ton for the first time in over three years, reaching $3,015.50 on the LME amid tightening supply from Chinese capacity caps and European production constraints due to high electricity prices. Global inventories are declining while demand from construction and renewables stays robust. Futures rallied 17% last year, the most since 2021.

item.title: Aluminium Price Spikes Driven by Global Supply Concerns in 2026
item.description: London Metal Exchange aluminum futures hit $3,008 per tonne in January 2026, breaking above $3,000 for the first time since mid-2022. The spike is attributed to global supply constraints affecting production.

item.title: Aluminum prices top $3,000 for the first time since 2022 as supply risks grow
item.description: Aluminum prices have exceeded $3,000 per ton for the first time since 2022, fueled by growing supply risks including production limits in China and Europe.

item.title: Aluminum price hits $3,000 for first time since 2022 on supply concern
item.description: Aluminum climbed above $3,000 per ton for the first time in over three years, driven by a tightening supply outlook and strong long-term demand expectations. A cap on Chinese smelting capacity and European production constraints from high electricity prices have reduced global inventories, while construction and renewable energy sectors maintain robust demand.

item.title: ALUMINIUM 2026: Pioneering Sustainability and Innovation
item.description: The global aluminum industry will converge at ALUMINIUM 2026, held October 6–8 in Düsseldorf, Germany, focusing on sustainability, innovation, and collaboration. The event highlights secondary aluminum's role in decarbonization, advancements in metal processing, recycling, casting, automation, and surface finishing. New features include Hall 7A for semi-finished products, an expanded ALUMINIUM Conference, and a Sustainability & Recycling Conference.

item.title: Aerosol can features Elysis primary aluminum, recycled content
item.description: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever have partnered to create an aerosol can using 50% Elysis carbon-free primary aluminum and 50% postconsumer recycled content, marking the first use of this technology in consumer packaging. Elysis, a joint venture between Alcoa and Rio Tinto, employs inert anode technology to eliminate direct greenhouse gas emissions from smelting by producing oxygen instead of CO₂. This collaboration demonstrates low-carbon innovation across the aluminum value chain to meet decarbonization goals.

item.title: Aluminium's unifying approach to net-zero transformation
item.description: Alcoa and Rio Tinto are demonstrating Elysis zero-carbon smelting technology industrially, while Alcoa pioneers mechanical vapour recompression to reduce alumina refining emissions. Emirates Global Aluminium's CelestiAL uses solar power to lower production carbon intensity, and the industry is advancing recycling and clean energy investments. These efforts position aluminum as a key sustainable metal for net-zero across applications like EVs and renewable infrastructure.

item.title: The more sustainability and transparency, the better the decisions
item.description: Speira utilizes advanced technologies and AI in recycling to champion transparency and sustainability, focusing on carbon footprint reduction. Their RIVOS products combine external scrap and low-carbon primary metal, tailored to regional sustainable energy, maximizing efficiency and minimizing emissions. This third-party certified approach helps customers select sustainable aluminum closer to net zero.

item.title: EU's carbon border tax on heavy industry goods goes into effect ...
item.description: The EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) takes effect on January 1, 2026, requiring steel and aluminium exporters to pay for CO2 emissions linked to their production. This aims to protect EU manufacturers from less stringent foreign regulations but risks trade escalation and higher costs for importers. Revenues from CBAM, projected at €1.5 billion by 2028, will fund support for affected industries.

item.title: Overcapacity, China focuses on controlling steel production
item.description: China plans to maintain strict control over crude steel production during 2026-2030 to address overcapacity issues. This policy reaffirms government efforts to manage supply amid global concerns about excess steel output.

item.title: Blastr Green Steel's Strategic Water Innovation with Ecolab - AInvest
item.description: Blastr Green Steel partners with Ecolab to redefine water management in ultra-low CO₂ steel production, offering a blueprint for decarbonizing heavy industries. The collaboration reduces water and energy use, aligns with EU climate goals like CBAM, and enhances ESG credentials. It demonstrates how sustainability can drive profitability in the green steel race.

item.title: Advancing Electric Smelting for Sustainable Iron Production: Pilot-Scale Validation of Controlled Open-Arc DC Technology by Metix Pty Ltd
item.description: A feature article discusses advancing electric smelting technology for sustainable iron production. It covers pilot-scale validation of controlled open-arc DC technology by Metix Pty Ltd. This innovation aims to enhance sustainability in iron and steelmaking processes.

item.title: Chile's Mantoverde Copper Mine Strike, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Lower Last Friday - SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes
item.description: Union #2 at Capstone Copper's Mantoverde copper mine in Chile commenced strike action on January 2, affecting 22% of the workforce and reducing operations to about 30% of normal production. The company remains open to negotiations. LME copper futures fluctuated and closed lower at $12,460.5/mt, down 0.29%.

item.title: Southern Copper Corporation's Decade-Long Copper Production Growth Strategy: Strategic Capital Deployment and Long-Term Scalability
item.description: Southern Copper is advancing projects like Tia Maria despite delays from protests, mobilizing 1,900 workers to bolster Peru's copper production. The $2.6 billion Los Chancas project faces illegal mining challenges but is set to start in 2030-2031, adding significant output. These efforts support long-term capacity expansion.

item.title: Nickel price extends rebound after Indonesia signals mine output cut
item.description: Nickel prices on the LME rose 0.7% to $14,750 a ton, extending gains over 3% from an eight-month low following Indonesia's proposal to cut nickel ore production to 250 million tons in 2026 from 379 million tons this year. The reduction addresses a slump in prices amid oversupply from Indonesia and China outpacing demand. Analysts predict nickel will outperform other base metals in 2026 if the cut proceeds.

item.title: Vale Indonesia Paused Nickel Mining While Waiting On 2026 Permits
item.description: PT Vale Indonesia has paused nickel mining operations while awaiting Indonesian government approval for its 2026 production plan. The smelter organization FINI anticipates nickel demand to reach 340-350 million metric tons by 2026, up 50 million from the previous year. Regulatory approvals are significantly influencing nickel market dynamics.

item.title: Nickel Supply Woes: Innovations Steering a Sustainable EV Future
item.description: The article discusses challenges in nickel supply for high-nickel NMC batteries amid surging demand from China, the US, and EU. It highlights innovations like LFP batteries, sodium-ion batteries, battery recycling, and smaller batteries to reduce nickel dependency and promote sustainability. Alaska Energy Metals Corporation is advancing sustainable nickel sourcing through its Nikolai project in Alaska.

item.title: Nickel's role in the future of safer electric vehicle batteries
item.description: Researchers from The University of Texas at Austin and Argonne National Laboratory analyzed high-nickel cathodes, which offer higher energy density for longer EV ranges but face stability issues. The study identifies critical states of charge based on metal-oxygen bonds and surface reactivity to enhance thermal stability and safety. These findings provide a roadmap for safer, efficient EV batteries.

item.title: Mining with integrity to advance sustainable nickel downstreaming
item.description: The article covers a company's commitment to sustainable nickel production through emission reductions. It aims to cut emissions by 33% by 2030 and reduce carbon intensity of nickel products by up to 50%. This supports ethical mining and downstream processing for sustainability.

item.title: Tenaris Acquires isOplus Oil and Gas Division in $10M Deal, Expands Pipe Coating Business
item.description: Tenaris has acquired the oil and gas division of isOplus for $10 million, gaining ownership of pre-insulated pipeline systems for district heating and anti-corrosion coatings in Europe. The acquired business unit has been rebranded as Tenaris Coating Italy, focusing on anti-corrosion coatings for oil and gas pipelines applied at Tenaris facilities in Italy, Mexico, Argentina, and Brazil. This strategic move aims to reduce delivery times, ensure quality standards, lower logistical costs, and minimize environmental impact, as stated by Andrea Previtali, Vice President Line Pipe and Process at Tenaris.

item.title: Off-Season, coupled with high aluminium prices, the proportion of liquid aluminium declined in December
item.description: High aluminum prices combined with the off-season led to a decline in the proportion of liquid aluminum in December. This reflects broader market trends affecting aluminum usage and supply dynamics.

item.title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: Steel prices fell to 3,096 Yuan/MT on January 2, 2026, down 0.32% daily amid soft Chinese demand, with rebar futures maintaining pullbacks from recent highs. Forecasts predict trading at 3014.96 Yuan/MT by quarter-end and 2868.13 in 12 months. Recent news highlights steel rises on improving profitability and pressures from regulatory export concerns.

item.title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: HRC Steel fell to 931.97 USD/T on January 2, 2026, down 0.32% daily, though up 2.87% monthly and 31.63% yearly. Forecasts expect 949.49 USD/T by quarter-end and 1042.73 in 12 months. Recent updates note rises to 940 USD/T on December 31 amid improving trends.

item.title: SMM: Copper Wire & Cable Industry's Jan Operating Rate to Edge Up MoM, Still Below Normal
item.description: SMM reports that China's copper wire and cable industry's operating rate for January 2026 is expected to edge up month-over-month but remain below normal levels. Domestic prices are suspended during the New Year holiday, with overseas prices resuming on January 2. This reflects ongoing market adjustments amid high prices.

item.title: SMM: Copper Wire & Cable Operating Rate Drops Further Amid High Prices, Holidays
item.description: SMM indicates that the operating rate in China's copper wire and cable sector has dropped further due to high copper prices and holiday effects. This trend highlights supply chain pressures in the industry. Contact details provided for further research reports.

item.title: Austral Resources Defies Weather, Exceeds Copper Output Targets
item.description: Austral Resources (ASX:AR1) exceeded its Q4 copper production targets with 2,643 tonnes despite extreme weather in Northwest Queensland. December production hit a record 910 tonnes since the 2023 restructure, with no environmental issues and stable processing operations. Access to the Rocklands site is restricted due to flooding, but recovery is expected soon.

item.title: Austral Resources Beats Q4 Copper Output Guidance Despite Record Weather
item.description: Austral Resources surpassed Q4 copper production guidance of 2,610 tonnes, achieving 2,643 tonnes amid severe wet season weather. December output exceeded 910 tonnes, the highest post-2023 restructure, with Lady Annie and Mt Kelly sites maintaining full capacity. The company advances exploration with a 2026 drill program targeting oxide resources near processing facilities.

item.title: Nickel Industries partners with Sphere Corp in landmark ENC deal
item.description: Nickel Industries announced a strategic partnership with Sphere Corp, valuing its ENC HPAL project at US$2.4 billion, with Sphere acquiring a 10% stake and entering an offtake agreement for nickel cathode. The ENC project targets annual production of 72,000 tonnes of nickel metal upon commissioning, expected in early Q1 2026. This deal marks the first offtake for ENC material into Western markets, targeting aerospace and EV sectors.

item.title: Nickel Industries Rockets 8% as SpaceX Supplier Buys Into US$2.4B ENC HPAL Project
item.description: Nickel Industries' shares rose 8% following Sphere Corp's investment in the US$2.4 billion ENC HPAL project. Sphere, a SpaceX supplier, is acquiring a stake, supporting the project's development for nickel production. The deal highlights growing interest in Nickel Industries' capacity expansion.

item.title: Aluminum Hits 3-year High
item.description: Aluminum increased to 2999.00 USD/T, the highest since April 2022. Over the past 4 weeks, Aluminum gained 3.64%, and in the last 12 months, it increased 18.54%. The price rise reflects tightening supply conditions.

item.title: Steel development minister sets agenda for growth in 2026
item.description: Nigeria's Steel Development Minister outlines 2026 plans to revitalize Ajaokuta Steel Complex via MoUs with Chinese investors and original manufacturers, alongside $500 million in mini-LNG plants for power supply. Investments include a $400 million steel plant by Inner Galaxy Group in Ewekoro and Orbit Galvanised Steel Plant commissioning, boosting local production, jobs, and capacity.

item.title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: Nickel fell to 16,760 USD/T on January 2, 2026, down 0.48% from the previous day, though it has risen 12.97% over the past month and 10.27% year-over-year. UK nickel futures surged to $15,600 per tonne, the highest since May, after hitting four-year lows, as markets reconsider oversupply views. Indonesia proposed a 34% reduction in nickel output for 2026 to address oversupply and deteriorating ore grades.

item.title: Nickel reaches 14-month high following Vale Indonesia's halt to mining
item.description: Nickel prices hit a 14-month high after Vale Indonesia suspended mining operations due to a delay in annual production plan approval. The LME three-month nickel rose 1.4% to $16,875 per metric ton. Indonesia's planned cut in ore production by a third by 2026 further supported prices amid previous oversupply.

item.title: Nickel Industries says South Korea's Sphere to buy 10% stake in Indonesian project
item.description: South Korea's Sphere Corp will acquire a 10% stake in Nickel Industries' Excelsior Nickel Cobalt HPAL project in Indonesia's Central Sulawesi, capable of producing MHP, nickel sulphate, and cathode. The deal values the project at $2.4 billion and includes offtake agreements, amid soaring nickel prices from Indonesia's output cut plans. Funding is expected early Q1 2026.

item.title: South Korea's Sphere to invest in Indonesian Ni project
item.description: South Korea's Sphere will invest in a 10% stake of Nickel Industries' Excelsior nickel project in Indonesia, with production starting April-June 2026 and offtake of 10% nickel cathode. Indonesian MHP capacity is expanding significantly, with prices recently assessed at $132.50/mtu. The investment aligns with rising nickel prices from planned output cuts.

item.title: Nickel reaches 14-month high following Vale Indonesia's halt to mining
item.description: Nickel prices surged to a 14-month high of $16,945 per metric ton after Vale Indonesia suspended mining operations due to a delay in production plan approval. This follows Indonesia's announcement to cut ore production by a third by 2026 to support prices amid oversupply. The event highlights sustainability efforts through regulated supply in nickel production.

item.title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: Aluminum prices rose to 3,023.10 USD/T on January 2, 2026, up 0.91% daily amid concerns of insufficient supply. China, the top producer, prioritizes preventing overcapacity after breaching its 45 million ton cap, forcing smelters to limit 2026 output. UK futures exceeded $3,000 for the first time since 2022 due to supply constraints.

item.title: HRC Steel Hits 36-week High
item.description: HRC Steel increased to 941.00 USD/T, marking the highest level since April 2025. Over the past 4 weeks, Hot-Rolled Coil Steel gained 2.87%, and in the last 12 months, it rose 31.63%. This reflects upward momentum in steel prices amid recent market trends.[1]

item.title: Winter weather a factor as scrap market debates January pricing
item.description: US steelmakers are optimistic for 2026 with Section 232 tariffs supporting price hikes for long and flat products, but scrap price increases may be limited to $20-40/gt in January due to weather-reduced flows and historical trends. Mills like Oregon Steel Mills raised plate prices by $40/ton. Disagreement persists on scrap pricing amid barge issues and shifts in sourcing.[3]

item.title: Ivanhoe Mines begins copper anode production at new Congo smelter
item.description: Ivanhoe Mines started copper anode production on December 29, 2025, at its Kamoa-Kakula direct-to-blister smelter in the DRC, five weeks after heat-up and one week after first concentrate feed. The smelter has a 500,000 tonnes per annum capacity, the largest in Africa upon full ramp-up by year-end. 2026 production guidance is 380,000-420,000 tonnes, with sales boosted by 20,000 tonnes from destocking amid high copper prices.

item.title: Greenland grants 30-year permit to EU-backed Molybdenum mine
item.description: Greenland Resources has received a 30-year permit for its Malmbjerg molybdenum mine, supported by the European Raw Materials Alliance. The project has off-take agreements with Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali and Finland's Outokumpu. Greenland’s Minister highlighted it as a step toward economic autonomy.

item.title: LME aluminium cash climbs to $2,985.5/t as opening stocks ease 0.49% to 509,250t
item.description: LME aluminum cash prices reached $2,985.5 per tonne as warehouse inventory declined to 509,250 tonnes. The 3-month contract strengthened to $3,010 per tonne, with December 2026 futures also showing gains of approximately 1.10 percent.

item.title: L&T wins Orders (Major*) for Minerals & Metals Business
item.description: Larsen & Toubro's Minerals & Metals business secures major orders from Steel Authority of India (SAIL) for expanding IISCO Steel Plant capacity from 2.5 MTPA to 6.5 MTPA. The package includes engineering, procurement, and installation for Coke Oven Battery, By-Product Plant, Basic Oxygen Furnace, and material handling. This supports India's steel manufacturing through innovation, capacity augmentation, and sustainable development.

item.title: Tenaris S A : Weekly Report (December 29, 2025 – January 2, 2026) on the Share Buyback Program
item.description: Under its Second Tranche of the USD1.2 billion Share Buyback Program, Tenaris repurchased 3,320,025 ordinary shares from December 29, 2025, to January 2, 2026, for approximately USD64.2 million. As of January 2, 2026, the company holds 62,328,172 treasury shares, equating to 5.81% of total issued share capital, with plans to cancel them in due course. Details of the transactions are available on Tenaris's investor relations website.

item.title: Aluminum prices top $3000 for the first time since 2022 as supply risks grow
item.description: Global aluminium prices surged to $3,000 per tonne, the highest in over three years. The increase is driven by China's production cap and rising demand in key sectors. Supply risks continue to support the upward trend.

item.title: Year-End Aluminum Ingot Inventory Alert Sounded! Domestic Inventory Buildup in Q1 2026 a Foregone Conclusion
item.description: Domestic aluminum production increased 1.9% year-over-year and 4.0% month-over-month in December, driven by ongoing commissioning of new electrolytic aluminum projects in Inner Mongolia and Xinjiang. Casting volumes are expected to continue increasing before Chinese New Year, with domestic aluminum ingot inventory projected to reach around 730,000 tonnes by end-January 2026, creating inventory buildup pressure in Q1.

item.title: Macro policies remain positive, aluminium prices hit new highs during the week
item.description: New aluminum projects in China and Indonesia continued ramping up production, with a new Inner Mongolia facility successfully powering on December 20. However, high prices suppressed downstream demand, with the operating rate of leading domestic aluminum processing enterprises falling to 59.9%, while inventory is forecast to rise to 730,000 tonnes by end-January 2026.

item.title: Aluminum Hits 3-year High
item.description: Aluminum prices reached $2,999 per tonne, the highest level since April 2022, as China faces pressure to restrain output growth in 2026 due to approaching its 45 million ton annual production cap. The commodity gained 3.64% over the past four weeks and 18.54% over the past 12 months.

item.title: Aluminum Rises Past $3,000
item.description: Aluminum futures in the UK surpassed $3,000 per tonne for the first time since 2022 at the turn of the year, driven by growing concerns about insufficient global supply amid structural constraints in production capacity.

item.title: Move over gold and silver: Copper, aluminium head for monster rally in 2026
item.description: Aluminum prices climbed past $3,000 per tonne for the first time in over three years, lifted by structural supply constraints including China's smelting capacity caps and reduced European output due to high power costs. Strong long-term demand from construction, renewable energy, and infrastructure projects continues to support prices, with futures rising 17% in 2025.

item.title: Nickel Higher on Mine Suspension
item.description: Nickel rose 1.6% to $16,910, breaking 14-month highs following the suspension of Vale's Indonesia mine. Recent support comes from Indonesia's announcement to cut nickel ore output by a third in 2026 to support prices. This occurs amid broader base metal movements, with demand in China remaining resilient.

item.title: Vale Indonesia halts mining activities on delayed approval for 2026 output plan
item.description: PT Vale Indonesia suspended mining operations due to delays in obtaining government approval for its 2026 production plan. Indonesia's nickel smelter association FINI forecasts domestic demand will reach 340-350 million metric tons in 2026, representing an annual increase of up to 50 million tons.

item.title: Nickel notches 14-month high after Vale Indonesia halts mining
item.description: Nickel reached its highest price in more than 14 months following Vale Indonesia's suspension of mining activities. The price increase reflects market response to Indonesia's announced production cuts designed to support commodity prices.

item.title: Nickel's New Era: Rising Prices, Growing EV Demand, and Major Projects Moving Forward
item.description: The nickel market is shifting due to Indonesia's supply management, driving prices from $14,200 to $16,500 per ton since mid-December 2025, with projections up to $18,500-$20,000. Policies include shorter mining licenses, mine closures, and bans on new processing plants, countering prior surpluses. North American projects and EV demand signal stronger conditions for 2026.

item.title: COMMODITIES 2026: Mexican Aluminum Prices Poised to Rise After Atypical Year
item.description: Mexican aluminum industry sources expect 2026 to bring price increases and a more dynamic market despite ongoing Trump tariffs. Prices climbed back to $330/mt by year-end 2025, with some sources predicting premiums could surpass $400/mt.

item.title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 04.01.2026
item.description: SteelRadar provides daily updates on global iron and steel prices, including Shanghai Futures Rebar 3-month term and various 1-month futures for Turkey, China, Europe, and North America, all showing no change as of 02.01.2026. The platform offers analyses and comments on industry trends. This reflects stable futures pricing at the start of 2026.[6]

item.title: Fertiliser, steel prices fall; cement remains stable
item.description: Steel bar prices in Pakistan have fallen to a range of Rs220,000 to Rs230,000 per tonne from Rs240,000 to Rs250,000 per tonne as of early January 2026, due to weak demand. The Secretary General of the Pakistan Association of Large Steel Producers noted leading brands at Rs226,000 per tonne, with some as low as Rs215,000. This decline aligns with broader price reductions in fertilizers while cement prices remain stable amid rising construction demand.[4]

item.title: Vale Indonesia halts mining amid delayed 2026 output approval
item.description: PT Vale Indonesia suspended mining activities due to delays in government approval of its 2026 annual production plan (RKAB). The halt comes as Indonesia's government plans to cut nickel output quotas to support prices, with Deputy Mining Minister Yuliot Tanjung stating the approval is "currently being consolidated."

item.title: Tenaris to invest in hydrogen steelmaking in Italy
item.description: Tubemaker Tenaris has signed an agreement with Italian energy suppliers Edison and Snam for a project aimed at using hydrogen in steelmaking operations at the Tenaris Dalmine seamless tube plant in Italy. The project will study hydrogen supply and adapt the mill to use the gas in the steelmaking process, which could further lower CO2 emissions from the electric arc furnace-based steelmaker.

item.title: Tenaris Acquires isOplus Oil and Gas Division in $10M Deal
item.description: Tenaris acquired the oil and gas division of isOplus for $10 million, gaining ownership of pre-insulated pipeline systems and anti-corrosion coatings. The business unit was rebranded as Tenaris Coating Italy and will apply anti-corrosion coatings to line pipes at Tenaris facilities across Italy, Mexico, Argentina, and Brazil.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Rise Slightly on January 5, South Korean President Lee Jae-myung Makes First Visit to China
item.description: Nickel prices rose slightly on January 5 according to the SMM midday review. The update coincides with South Korean President Lee Jae-myung's first visit to China. This reflects ongoing market movements in nickel amid regional developments.

item.title: Aluminum starts the year on a bullish note
item.description: Aluminum prices have surpassed $3,000 per ton on U.S. and European exchanges, with the Comex exchange listing aluminum at $3,050.75 per metric ton. Supply-side factors driving the price increase include declining output in China due to government-imposed smelting capacity caps and production constraints in Europe from high electricity prices, while demand from construction and renewable sectors remains robust.

item.title: PRICE INCREASE ANNOUNCEMENT - January 5, 2026
item.description: Domestic steel mills announced sharp price increases for all January 2026 orders across all markets. The hikes are driven by various market factors pressuring steel pricing.

item.title: Korea steel industry faces triple hit from structural slump, tariffs, and ...
item.description: Korea's steel industry anticipates ongoing challenges in 2026 due to structural downturns, tariff burdens, and weak demand in real estate and construction. Cumulative crude steel production from January to November 2025 was 56.1 million tons, down 3.7% year-over-year, potentially reaching the lowest in 15 years. Experts highlight a mismatch between production capacity and demand in both domestic and export markets.

item.title: Shanghai copper kicks off 2026 strong on supply jitters
item.description: Shanghai copper opened the year strongly due to intensified supply concerns from a strike at a Chilean mine. The most-active copper contract rose amid these jitters. This reflects broader market sensitivity to production disruptions.

item.title: Capstone Copper (ASX:CSC) Drops on Chile Strike
item.description: Capstone Copper's shares fell 4% to A$14.51 following a strike by workers at its Mantoverde mine in Chile starting January 2, 2026. The strike impacts operations at this key copper facility. This event highlights vulnerabilities in copper supply chains.

item.description: Sphere has joined Nickel Industries' ENC move in Indonesia, signaling new developments in nickel operations or investments.
